metadata.dc:author: Pérez Abad, M
Giacalone, F
Llusa Pérez, M
metadata.dc:description: Dorsal wrist pain is a very common cause of complaint in the clinical practice of the hand surgeon. Such pain can frequently be related to traumatic, inflammatory or degenerative diseases, but sometimes its origin is far away from these common causes. A rare case is reported of chronic dorsal wrist pain of neuropathic origin, due to a pre-capsular neuroma of the posterior interosseous nerve. Possible causes, diagnostic hints, and treatment options are thoroughly discussed.
metadata.dc:subject: Posterior interosseous nerve
Wrist pain
Dolor muñeca
Neuroma
Nervio interóseo posterior
metadata.dc:title: El neuroma de la porción distal del nervio interóseo posterior como causa de dolor dorsal persistente de muñeca.
Neuroma of the distal posterior interosseous nerve as a cause of persistent dorsal wrist pain.
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de cirugia ortopedica y traumatologia
